description: First floor side extension, single storey rear extension and side porch extension to the existing single storey side part of the dwellinghouse, and the subdivision of the property to create two self-contained dwellings with associated vehicular access (following the demolition of part of the side extension).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 301/01 (Site Plan & Location Plan), 301/02 (Existing Floor Plans), 301/03 (Existing Elevations), 301/04 (Proposed Floor Plans), 301/05 (Proposed Elevations), 301/06 (Vehicular Crossover Details) as revised and received 13/04/12, and any plans subsequently submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in connection with planning condition 3 of this planning permission, all unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the submitted and approved plans, details of a revised roof design for the side porch and single storey rear projection shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall thereafter be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the design of the development harmonises with the development and the character of the area in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), The Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1-7.6 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  Reason:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), The Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1-7.6 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A - F of Part 1, and Class B of part 2 Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no general or roof extensions or alterations, porches, outbuildings, garden hardstanding, or accesses to the highway shall be carried out to the dwellinghouse hereby approved, and the existing dwellinghouse at no. 22 Russell Road, Northolt without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site, to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), The Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1-7.6 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The new residential dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is fully accessible to all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), The Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 (Accessible Ealing), policy 7.2 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The car parking spaces and manoeuvring space shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the dwellinghouse hereby approved, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and manoeuvring and shall not be used for any other purpose, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 	 Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking  within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be constructed or retained shall be submitted to and improved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The boundary treatment shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.   Reason:  To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), The Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), policies 3.5, 7.1-7.6 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The proposed first floor windows on the side (eastern) and rear (northern) elevations of the new dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be fitted with non-openable and obscure glazed windows up to a height of 1.7 m above finished floor level at first floor. A sample of the obscure glazing, no smaller than 300 mm square shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the sample thus approved.  The details so approved shall be retained permanently, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of the future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), and policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans details of hard and soft landscaping works (including permeable paving for parking and access areas) shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. Hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, or in accordance with the programme of works agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped and in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.8, 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), The Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Supplementary Planning Guidance 9: Trees and Development Guidelines,  policies 7.4-7.5 and 7.21 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) | The new vehicular access crossover as approved shall be constructed before the new dwellinghouse is first occupied.  Reason: In the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policies 6.3 and 6.7 of the London Plan (2011). | There shall be no obstruction above 0.6m in height at any time within pedestrian visibility splay areas at the back line of the footway / access road  that measure 1.5m deep and 1.5m wide at either side of the vehicular access points to the site.   Reason: In the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policies 6.3 and 6.7 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of the design and location of on site refuse and recycling facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The refuse and recycling facilities shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, and permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.    Reason: To ensure that adequate refuse and recycling storage and management arrangements are provided all in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1 and 9.1 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 - Refuse and Recycling Facilities.
